section.title: Initializing the Database
section.para: Create a MySQL database that the user specified in Config.pm have full read and write permissions to. Fill the database using $DIST/site/sql/create_tables.sql. This will create a default super-user named root with password root.

section.title: Logging to the Web Interface
section.para: Access the site's URL and access the admin link. Log in as root, with password root. (make sure you change the password afterwards). Now, you can start adding clubs and users and set up the system.

section.title: Basic Operation Concepts
section.para: The system manages several clubs, and several users. A user may be a super-admin, in which case he can edit users and edit the clubs' data as he pleases. If not, he is restricted to editing the data of the clubs to which he has permissions to.

For each club, there are three levels of usability by a non super-admin user. Either that user may not do anything with the club; or he can add or edit seminars, but not manage the subjects list; lastly, it is possible that he can also manage the list of subjects that are associated with that specific club.

When a seminar is created, it is owned by the club that created it under one of its subjects. This seminar can then be associated with other subjects, including those of other clubs. Alternatively, it can be disassociated from subjects it had been associated with previously.
Seminars may not be deleted, but non-associated are not displayed to the general public.
